metadata.title: CVE-2023-38406 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
bgpd/bgp_flowspec.c in FRRouting (FRR) before 8.4.3 mishandles an nlrilength of zero, aka a "flowspec overflow."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38406` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1
frr-pythontools - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1
frr-snmp - 8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: frr package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.4.4-1.1ubuntu1').
